intro: Hieracium amaurophylloides, commonly known as the dark-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant features dark green, broad leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical structure supports its role as a pioneer species in disturbed environments.
